article.headline: Mercer 88, Florida Gulf Coast 63
article.story: MACON, Ga. -- E.J. Kusnyer scored 21 points and Calvin Henry just missed a triple-double in an 88-63 win over Florida Gulf Coast on Friday night. Henry finished with 17 points, 12 rebounds and a career-high nine blocked shots for the Bears (9-8, 3-3 Atlantic Sun Conference), who snapped the Eagles' four-game winning streak. Mercer cruised to a 47-29 halftime lead and led by as many as 28 points late in the game. Kusnyer was 6-for-12 from 3-point range. James Florence added 18 points for the Bears and Daniel Emerson had his seventh double-double of the season with 14 points and 15 rebounds. Mercer outrebounded Florida Gulf Coast 51-37. The Eagles (8-11, 4-4) shot 35.8 percent from the field (24 of 67) and were 8-for-17 from the free-throw line. Reed Baker led Florida Gulf Coast with 19 points, while Kyle Marks added 16 and Delvin Franklin had 12.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.
